programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Our hearty frittata is just as filling as an omelet, but a whole lot easier to prepare and serve. We also uncover the formula for the ideal quiche filling and deliver a tender, buttery pastry crust filled with moist, smooth custard.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we look at a few of our favorite Tex-Mex dishes: tomato salsa, quesadillas, and beef tacos.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: The test kitchen shows you how to make two hearty soups: black bean and tortilla.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What could be more synonymous with fall than butternut squash? In this episode, we explore two main-course squash recipes: a creamy, comforting soup perfect for serving on a busy weeknight and a rich, hearty risotto suitable for entertaining.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We investigate inexpensive steaks and find out which were worth eating and how best to prepare them. We also take a look at a classic accompaniment to steak: mashed potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: When most people think of dishes like lasagna and jambalaya, they think of labor-intensive weekend meals. In this episode, however, we develop versions that could be prepared on a busy weeknight.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Two old-fashioned dishes with modern appeal: Boston baked beans and chicken and dumplings. Neither requires fancy ingredients or expensive equipment, just a little time and effort.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and simple to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There are certain dinners we rely on again and again. We are particularly fond of roasting chicken and potatoes together in one pan. While the chicken roasts, its juices drip onto the potatoes, giving them a wonderfully rich crust and creamy flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Thanksgiving can strike fear into the heart of even the most proficient cook. However with our turkey and sweet potato casserole recipes, we minimize the work so that the cook can enjoy the holiday as much as everyone else.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We develop a foolproof preparation for pork chops with vinegar and peppers—a modern version tangy and juicy enough to rival that prepared by an Italian grandmother. Next, we turn to pan-roasted pork tenderloin.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Tuna, which is often served rare to medium-rare, can be particularly tricky to get just right with a nicely seared crust. As for halibut, we developed a technique that ensured perfect texture without a loss of flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Some people are intimidated by the thought of preparing fish. Traditional dishes, like Fish Meunière, can seem even more daunting. But you don't need to be wearing a toque to prepare this French classic well.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Most Italian recipes seem startlingly easy to prepare, requiring just a few simple ingredients. But some dishes need special care to reach their full potential. In this episode, we demystify two Italian classics: Fettuccine Alfredo and Beef in Barolo.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: When you eat chicken frequently, it pays to have a number of preparations on hand. In this episode, we turn to orange-flavored chicken and chicken teriyaki.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: One of our favorite Spanish dishes is paella. But with a lengthy ingredient list the shopping alone can give the home cook pause. We take a hard look at paella to see if we can pare back this dish to its humble origins without losing its alluring flavors.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill—one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pork loin is delicious roasted in the oven, but it takes on a new character when cooked on the grill. The fire imparts a delicate smokiness to the meat, and the heat creates a handsome crust. French potato salad is a perfect counterpoint to the pork.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic—cornbread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: If you're a fan of saucy barbecued chicken, you'll love pulled chicken. Similar to the more traditional pulled pork, it's simply tender shreds of smoky grilled chicken moistened with barbecue sauce.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Ashley shows Bridget how to tackle Texas-sized, Thick Cut Smoked Pork Chops. Then, Adam reveals his pick for dry measuring cups. Finally, Julia reveals the secret to achieving the perfect Backyard Barbecue Beans.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan teaches Julia how to make the perfect South Carolina Smoked Fresh Ham. Then, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of Spiral Sliced Hams. Adam reveals his pick for potato mashers. Finally, Christie shares a Smashed Potato Salad recipe with Bridget.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia grill up Sausage and Peppers. Then, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of whole-wheat sandwich bread. Next, Adam reviews disposable plates.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting—the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: German chocolate cake—filled with sticky pecans and coconut—is not without flaws. We set out to develop a German chocolate cake that avoids the common pitfalls and delivers on its promise.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to make a meatloaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish—skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dinners prepared entirely in one skillet are perfect for weeknight cooking. Less cleanup is one obvious benefit. A skillet also gives the cook a bit more control over cooking multiple elements.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First, we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.desc: Debuting in the Second Wars, to becoming the most successful Robot ever to take part in Robot Wars. The Razer Robot put the squeeze on all the competition, including the House Robots.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This round determines which of the fighting machines makes it into the grand final, along with the final two robots to compete in the Ten Robot Rumble. Thor, Coyote, Expulsion, Hobgoblin, Push to Exit and Magnetar battle it out.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The illustrious grand final begins with the biggest battle in Robot Wars history. The second and third place robots from the heats will battle it out in a fight to the death to determine who will be the 6th and final robot in the grand final.

programme.title: Martha Cooks

programme.title: 10 Tokyo Warriors: The Final Battle
programme.desc: Long ago, the land was in a state of chaos as the feudal lords waged territorial wars. In the midst of the bloodshed, a ferocious warrior, known as the Demon King, appeared and conquered all. It is now 400 years later.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden: The Movie
programme.desc: A long time ago, a powerful spirit drove the world to the brink of destruction. Naruto's latest mission is to protect Shion, a priestess from the Land of Ogres, whom the spirit is after.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Bonds
programme.desc: Mysterious flying ninja have launched a sudden attack against the Leaf. To save their village, Naruto and his friends set out to stop this new threat.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Will of Fire
programme.desc: Four Kekkei Genkai shinobi who have been guarding the Cloud, Stone, Mist and Sand disappear without a trace. At the same time, Naruto discovers that Kakashi has left the village.

programme.title: Road to Ninja : Naruto the Movie
programme.desc: Naruto and his friends succeed in driving away the infamous Akatsuki, who have mysteriously returned from the dead, but afterwards, a strange masked figure appears before him!

programme.title: Project A-Ko

programme.title: Project A-Ko 2: Plot of the Daitokuji Financial Group
programme.desc: Three weeks after the alien ship landing on Graviton City, A-ko and the gang go on summer vacation. Meanwhile, chaos breaks out when B-ko's father arms the local military with new mecha to attack the alien ship.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 3: Cinderella Rhapsody
programme.desc: While working part-time at a fast food joint, A-ko falls for the mysterious Kei. While B-ko happens to like him as well, both of them are unaware that C-ko is the apple of Kei's eyes.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 4: Final
programme.desc: While A-ko and B-ko's rivalry over Kei intensifies over a surprise marriage proposal, another alien fleet is headed on its way towards Earth.

programme.desc: The tables turn when a seasoned hostage negotiator takes hostages and risks all to prove his own innocence.

programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and 50 Cent star as inmates who must break out of a top secret, high-security prison in this non-stop action-thriller.

programme.title: Cadia: The World Within
programme.desc: Devastated by the loss of their mother, three teens discover a mystical realm ruled by unseen forces and must overcome evil in the order to return home.

programme.title: Switched
programme.desc: Tired of being bullied, Cassandra Evans prays that her nemesis, Katie Sharp, the queen bee of social media, would know what it's like to walk a day in her shoes. Her prayer is answered in an unexpected way when they get "Switched."

programme.title: Not to Forget
programme.desc: After a life of little scams, a self-centered millennial is sentenced to take care of his grandmother, who is affected by Alzheimer's. As he realizes the extent of her wealth, the protagonist gets closer to the treasure he's been looking for.

programme.title: My Dog The Space Traveller
programme.desc: When a boy loses his dog in his backyard he finds it’s gone through a portal which leads to another dimension of our universe. He must rely on his friends and family to get his dog back before the portal closes.

programme.title: Benji
programme.desc: Two school kids strike up a friendship with an orphaned puppy named Benji. When danger befalls them and they end up kidnapped by robbers who are in over their heads, Benji and his scruffy sidekick come to the rescue.

programme.title: Time Toys
programme.desc: A group of kids stumble upon a chest full of toys from the future. The discovery takes them on an adventure using their new-found toys to save their neighbourhood and the world from a maniacal madman. A fun, futuristic adventure for all the family.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
programme.desc: One of puppet-maker Geppetto's creations, a puppet called Pinocchio, magically comes to life. In order to become a real boy, Pinocchio must go on a daring adventure and learn valuable lessons.

programme.title: Knucklehead
programme.desc: After incurring a large debt with a local criminal ringleader, Eddie Sullivan creates a get-rich-quick scheme and enlists a gentle giant named Walter as his unwitting accomplice.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: When 7-year-old Albert's mother is suddenly killed in an auto accident, he and his imaginary French friend "Bogus" take up residence with his no-nonsense aunt Harriet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Beta Kappa
programme.desc: The tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, know that they have to rely on each other to get the job done, but sometimes trusting the competition isn't such a good idea.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sharks and Recreation
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the pressure begins to take a toll on the captains.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Mighty Bite
programme.desc: With only two weeks left in the fishing season and the price of blue fin tuna on the rise, the Gloucester captains race to bring in record hauls.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Reckoning
programme.desc: There is only one week of fishing left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and the Gloucester fleet is set for a final showdown in a bid to catch the last monster tuna of the year.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Head To Tail (Special)
programme.desc: It's a look back at the best moments from two seasons of Wicked Tuna, featuring the wildest catches and fiercest rivalries, plus a sneak peek at the upcoming third season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Wicked Return
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out for Jeffrey's Ledge in hopes of catching the first fish of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Checkmate
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Blue Fin Tuna Season and the Gloucester captains and their crews, from rookies to old pros, get put to the test.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Into The Storm
programme.desc: Bad weather threatens to end the fishing week for the Gloucester fishermen, but while some boats head for home, others decide to take on Mother Nature's wrath.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Operation T.U.N.A
programme.desc: As the hunt for blue fin tuna intensifies, the fisherman resort to espionage for information.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mission: Fishin!
programme.desc: As Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fleet charges into the heart of the fishing season, it's a tight race for the coveted title of top-earning boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Latitude
programme.desc: It's almost halfway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and the Gloucester fleet has hit a lull in fishing.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle Royale
programme.desc: With the second half of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna fishing season now underway, competition amongst the Gloucester fleet intensifies when tuna become scarce.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Brotherly Shove
programme.desc: A new week calls for new techniques as the Gloucester Captains try unconventional methods to hook their next paycheck.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Blue Grit
programme.desc: Time is running out in the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and, this week, every boat in the Gloucester fleet is facing a different challenge.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Beta Kappa
programme.desc: The tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, know that they have to rely on each other to get the job done, but sometimes trusting the competition isn't such a good idea.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sharks and Recreation
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the pressure begins to take a toll on the captains.

programme.title: Laura Coates Live

programme.title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post
programme.desc: Based on the celebrated novel by Emily M. Danforth, this film follows the titular character (Chloë Grace Moretz) as she is sent to a gay conversion therapy center after getting caught with another girl in the back seat of a car on prom night.

programme.title: NITRAM
programme.desc: Based on a true story, Nitram is an isolated young man living with his parents in Australia until he meets an eccentric heiress. What follows is a gripping portrait of nihilism and violence.

programme.title: Ben is Back
programme.desc: 19 year-old Ben Burns unexpectedly returns home to his family's suburban home. His mother, Holly, is relieved but wary of her son staying clean. Over a turbulent day, truths are revealed, and her love for her son is tested as she tries to keep him safe.

programme.title: 6 Days
programme.desc: In 1980, armed gunmen stormed the Iranian Embassy in London, England, taking everyone hostage. After 6 days, a group of highly trained SAS soldiers launched an epic raid to end the standoff.

programme.title: OUT OF DEATH
programme.desc: A corrupt Sheriff's department in a rural mountain town comes undone when an unintended witness throws a wrench into their shady operation.

programme.title: CODE NAME BANSHEE
programme.desc: Caleb (Antonio Banderas), a former government assassin in hiding, resurfaces when his protégé, the equally deadly killer known as Banshee (Jaime King), discovers a bounty has been placed on Caleb's head.

programme.title: Sabotage
programme.desc: Members of an elite DEA task force find themselves being taken down one by one after they rob a drug cartel safe house.

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: When a bank is hit by a brutal heist, all evidence points to the owner and his high-powered clients. But as a group of FBI agents dig deeper into the case, it becomes clear that a larger conspiracy is at play.

programme.title: Sabotage
programme.desc: Members of an elite DEA task force find themselves being taken down one by one after they rob a drug cartel safe house.

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: When a bank is hit by a brutal heist, all evidence points to the owner and his high-powered clients. But as a group of FBI agents dig deeper into the case, it becomes clear that a larger conspiracy is at play.

programme.title: Fighting Ace
programme.desc: 20 years after the death of his parents, a martial artist sets out to avenge their deaths

programme.title: The Devil's In The Details
programme.desc: After serving a brutal tour of duty, veteran soldier Thomas Conrad is looking forward to a peaceful life at home with his family. But a drug cartel's ruthless enforcer has other plans for him.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: Based on a true story, ten fishermen from Cornwall are signed by Universal Records and achieve a top ten hit with their debut album of sea shanties.

programme.title: Stand Off
programme.desc: The botched robbery of a Belfast fish market puts an innocent American shopkeeper (Brendan Fraser) in the crosshairs of Irish police officers.

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Too Little
programme.desc: While thinking he's participating in a street theater performance, an American video store clerk is mistaken for an international spy and bumbles his way through a web of espionage, inadvertently besting Europe's top assassins.

programme.title: Life of Crime
programme.desc: The wife of a corrupt real estate developer is kidnapped by two common criminals, who intend to extort him with inside information about his crooked business and off-shore accounts.

programme.title: Goodbye Lover
programme.desc: A web of secrets, lies, and deceit hides beneath the surface of a family whose entanglements and murderous deeds result in a scathing and cynical commentary on the institutions of religion, politics and marriage.

programme.title: Life of Crime
programme.desc: The wife of a corrupt real estate developer is kidnapped by two common criminals, who intend to extort him with inside information about his crooked business and off-shore accounts.

programme.title: Goodbye Lover
programme.desc: A web of secrets, lies, and deceit hides beneath the surface of a family whose entanglements and murderous deeds result in a scathing and cynical commentary on the institutions of religion, politics and marriage.

programme.title: Are You Here
programme.desc: Two childhood best friends embark on a road trip back to their hometown after one of them learns he has inherited a large sum of money from his recently deceased estranged father.

programme.title: The Big Divorce
programme.desc: Mike Christian is a happily married man who runs into his high school sweetheart Alex and sparks still fly. Mike is determined Alex is his true soul mate, but he signed an iron-clad pre-nuptial agreement and his wife will not let him out of the marriage.

programme.title: You May Not Kiss The Bride
programme.desc: An unassuming pet photographer is thrown into serious action, adventure and romance when he's forced to marry a Croatian bride and spend his honeymoon at a remote tropical resort where she is kidnapped.

programme.title: For Better Or For Worse
programme.desc: A heartwarming romantic comedy about a woman who learns that perhaps there is such a thing as second chances when facing the pleasures and pains of love.

programme.title: Love on the Slopes
programme.desc: NYC-based copy editor, Alex, is sent to Ridgeline Resort, an extreme sports outpost, to write a story for a travel writing competition.

programme.title: The Dancing Detective: A Deadly Tango
programme.desc: Constance Bailey is a no-nonsense detective who prefers to work alone. When a high-profile CEO is murdered on the eve of his company’s corporate event in Malta Detective Bailey is sent undercover.

programme.title: The Love Club: Nicole
programme.desc: Freshly engaged interior designer, Nicole, still wonders if the one she is meant to be with is her mystery college pen pal whose letters she has kept all these years.

programme.title: Marry Me in Yosemite
programme.desc: Zoe, a notable photojournalist, visits Yosemite landscapes made famous by Ansel Adams. When she meets Jack, an intriguing tour guide, he opens her eyes to new adventures as they embark on a journey.

programme.title: Hearts of Spring
programme.desc: A successful mommy blogger decides to re-enter the world of dating and discovers the man she has been falling for is the same man she has been sparring with online.

programme.title: Once Upon a Prince
programme.desc: Susanna gladly accepts help one day from handsome stranger Nate at her parents’ garden store in small-town Georgia.

programme.title: Love Unleashed
programme.desc: While hosting a puppy party, Hailey meets single father Ryan.

programme.title: Wedding Every Weekend
programme.desc: Nate and Brooke are going to the same four weddings, four weekends in a row. To avoid set-ups, they go together as 'wedding buddies'. But what starts as a friendship soon becomes deeper.

programme.title: Tulips in Spring
programme.desc: An interior designer must halt her work on a big project in order to return home and assist her injured father at her family's tulip farm in rural Washington state.

programme.title: The Christmas Pact
programme.desc: Hailee, a well-known entertainment reporter for a network morning show, is humiliated when her oft-absent investment banker fiancé, Jason is revealed to be linked to a Beverly Hills socialite.

programme.title: A Family Christmas Gift
programme.desc: When Amber spends the holidays with her Aunt Dora and helps plan a fundraising Christmas Concert, it brings Amber closer to her aunt and a new love into her life.

programme.title: Mistletoe & Menorahs
programme.desc: When a toy company executive must learn about Hanukkah to land a big account, she enlists the help of her co-worker's friend, who also happens to be in need of turning his pad into a Christmas Wonderland.

programme.title: Our Italian Christmas Memories

programme.title: Debbie Macomber's A Mrs. Miracle Christmas
programme.desc: When a family faces loneliness and loss of faith, Mrs. Miracle swoops in to renew their Christmas Spirit, and they experience a holiday of heavenly proportions.

programme.title: Majestic Christmas

programme.title: Must Love Christmas

programme.title: Holiday Hearts
programme.desc: While planning an annual Christmas party, Peyton is forced together with Ben to care for a friend's daughter. While finding their Christmas spirit, will there be some romance along the way?

programme.title: The Rooftop Christmas Tree

programme.title: The Most Colorful time of the Year

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The progress of first cultivation attempts is slow. In India, the rural population, especially, needs affordable, well-tolerated medicine – medicine based on herbs. In Kerala, the film shows a family operation that hand-produces botanical medicine for the local market. High up in the Himalayas, we observe a village healer at work. The science of Ayurvedic medicine is five thousand years old. Today, interest in the ancient healing art is surging, not only in India. In Delhi’s Old Town, the film visits a wholesaler who supplies the booming global herb market, and we take a look inside the laboratories of the largest manufacturer of Ayurvedic medicines in the world. In Kerala, we meet a doctor employed at a small Ayurveda clinic, and in Nordern India, we join a student of Tibetan medicine on a hike up into the mountains, where she prepares for an exam in herbology.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on preserving this invaluable knowledge.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian distillery in Germany, Hubsi digs for protected gentian roots in Berchtesgaden National Park. For yellow gentian is one of the most bitter medicinal herbs in the world, well suited for schnapps and as a general tonic.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for entering and exiting the narrow blossom is strenuous. Within three weeks, maximum, Mladen must remove his bees from the island. Otherwise they will die of exhaustion. In Skopje, the capital of Macedonia, the film visits Iva Yosifova. Hollyhock provides the raw material for her objects of art. The herb is medically beneficial, due to its mucilage, which is added to many cough tea mixtures. Iva, though, makes paper from hollyhock. Thanks to the herb’s long fibres, the paper can be spread onto objects and modeled. The technique produces delicate sculptures, as fragile as nature.

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: The Moor
programme.desc: Moors and peatlands are oases in the cultivated landscape of Central Europe.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.desc: Butterflies surely are the most fancied species inside the insect world. Their beautiful colouring and their graceful flight appeal to everyone. There are close to 4000 types of Butterflies – today many of them are endangered due to the loss of their habitat.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.sub-title: Children of the Sun - Wild Bees
programme.desc: Most people associate honey producing insects with the name “BEE“. Few realize that there are over 560 different species of bees - most of them live their lives “busy as a bee“ but some “abuse“ other insects and others are even known to be murderers. The film “Wild Bees” shows the incredible diversity and the stunning adaptations of our “BEES” to various habitats and diverse living conditions. Fascinating fights, sensational performances, imposing structures and colorful individuals – the world of “Wild Bees” offers all of this and more.

programme.title: Mantises - Masters of Deception
programme.desc: They are killers. They kill with unbelievable precision. They fight Kung Fu style and are seen in Japan as a symbol of vigilance - the mantises. Their triangular head with its unique flexibility is conspicuous. Two overdimensioned eyes fixate the distance to their prey rapidly and three-dimensionally. The chest segment of the mantis is prolonged and equipped with spiny appendages that can spear their prey as fast as a jack knife. The mysterious aura that surrounds the praying mantis has a lot to do with the fact that they are rarely seen. They have adapted to their surroundings perfectly. No matter whether leaves, blossoms, tree bark, sandy floors or even orchids - the mantis adjusts to all environments.

programme.title: Follow Your Cat
programme.desc: Follow us while we follow cats on their hunting grounds for mice and birds. Experience the double life of your domestic tiger... she will lead you on adventures that you never thought were possible. With a behavioural scientist that specializes in cats and modern technology we follow the cat on their wanderings into the wild. She maps their routes, unveils their secret favourite places, chronicles their territorial conquests, and shows us the entertaining habits of this enigmatic creature.

programme.title: Dust And Stripes
programme.desc: In a never-ending quest for grass and water, the striped herds undertake an annual epic trek across the vast lunar landscape of the Kalahari’s Makgadikgadi Pans. Most of the year, the Makgadikgadi is an inhospitable wasteland of windswept, salt-encrusted pans. For the area’s water-dependent zebra, the Boteti River on the western edge of the pans is a dry-season lifeline. However, it is also a death trap, with lions waiting in ambush and crocodiles lurking in dark riverside caves.

programme.title: Namibia`s Desert Kingdom
programme.desc: Although the dunes are barren, the dry riverbeds show signs of growth. And out of the heat, vast shapes appear. A herd of desert elephants ambles along the dry riverbed sniffing the ground with their lazy trunks. These remarkable creatures can smell the water underground and know where to find it. An abandoned well attracts a troop of chacma baboons, followed by a small herd of oryx and springbok, and finally a group of jackals. None of them has seen the pride of desert lions lying in wait.

programme.title: Germany's Wild Birds
programme.desc: By monitoring ten interesting bird-watching locations, we document not only the silver herons in the Westerwald, but also the last great bustards in Havelland. Then there are the great crested grebes in their splendid plumages, shown building their nests and during courtship, in an area of extinct volcanoes: the Eiffel. Add to this, exotic wild birds and colorful parakeets, the newest members of the population in a park in Wiesbaden. We have resting migratory birds, ducks and waders on the west banks of the Steinhuder Lake. On the border to the Netherlands, in the moorlands near Münster, we find the only wild flamingos in Germany. Equally interesting are the fire geese, avocets and many birds of the coastal region not far from Hamburg harbor. At Federsee Lake in Upper Swabia, we observe the inhabitants of the extensive reed zones: bearded tits. Then we have the birds of fortune, the cranes, which interrupt their long journeys by resting on the Baltic coast. Last, but not least, in the Feldberg lake region we accompany the ranger on an exciting sea eagle excursion. With this film, you are invited to experience a journey through the wonderful world of birds.

programme.title: Cuckoo - The Enemy in My Nest
programme.desc: It’s no news that cuckoos are brood parasites: they lay their eggs into the nests of other bird species – a clever trick that spares the rearing of own offspring. Some even go as far as to kill the other chicks in the nest. But why do other parent birds let this happen? Are they too stupid? Too inept? Or simply clueless? Admittedly, cuckoo’s eggs do look deceptively genuine. But the cuckoo chick? Not even remotely! It quickly grows into a giant that looks nothing like its new family. So why don’t the adoptive parents notice the sham then? Until recently, the ornithologists’ theory was: the “victims” have yet to learn to counteract. Turns out: they may even profit from having strangers’ chicks in their nest! So is cuckoo’s behaviour a phenomenal trick or an evolutionary riddle?

programme.title: Beak & Brain - Genius Birds from Down Under
programme.desc: These child prodigies of the animal kingdom have feathers and beaks – and very special skills! The Keas of New Zealand are the only parrots that live in snowy mountain areas. They like testing their brains, solving puzzles and challenging tourists: they unscrew bottle-tops, dismantle windscreen wiper blades and tear open rucksacks. They seem so determined you’d think they have an understanding of physics and mechanics! Thousands of miles northwards, in New Caledonia, other birds have talent, too. Here bird expert Gavin Hunt discovered that crows are able to produce a whole set of tools, each designed for a particular purpose – the most intricate tool culture in the animal kingdom! These high flyers compete against each other: Keas vs Crows. What is the secret of their intelligence? It’s the ultimate avian I.Q. test, with some funny and surprising results.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. 'Deercam' allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but as intelligent and affectionate family animals.

programme.title: Unnatural Selection
programme.desc: The wings of cliff swallows in Nebraska are getting shorter – while female turtles in Chesapeake Bay are getting larger. On the Galapagos Islands, two species of finches are developing back into one. Increasing numbers of peregrine falcons are living in urban areas – and have adapted their behaviour: thanks to the city lights, they have learned to hunt at night.

programme.title: Wild Prairie Man
programme.desc: Located in the Northern Great Plains of Canada, Grasslands National Park has been a 20 year odyssey for wildlife photographer James R. Page. For James, critters are more interesting than people and he shares some of his iconic images and experiences from this endangered ecosystem. We showcase the parks wilderness that is dominated by prairie light and dark sky, the wildlife, prairie dogs, mesmerizing landscapes, and bisons. We immerse ourselves in the wild habitat of Grasslands National Park for over a year capturing some never before scenes in the Wild Prairie. James R. Page's connection to the land and the wildlife provides an unforgettable journey into the heart of this endangered ecosystem, while Park experts help us understand its complexity.

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.
